definition[0]: additional money that you get paid because of the high cost of living in a particular area
definition[1]: additional money paid to someone because of the higher costs of living in a particular area
example[1]: The salary is £35,000 a year, including aLondon weighting allowance.
definition[2]: an additional value given to certain figures in a calculation, in order to allow for their importance
example[2]: The bonus formula assigns a 20% weighting to profits and another 20% weighting to market share.
